rComments: I understand the perspective of other raters on this site re Frauely. On the face of it, it's tough and his lectures can be mundane (sometimes). But hands down, Prof F is the reason why Crim at uOttawa is the best Crim program. He is knowledgable and passionate in his craft and very inspirational. I found my passion in his classes also! 12/10.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'So many papers']

rComments: incredibly heavy reading load. 5 mandatory text books and online readings every week. each week you're expected to read about 100 pages. do not recommend this course unless that is all your energy and time are going into. very dry unless you are going into a masters or PHD. very little do with criminology. would avoid at all costs.

Avoid. He assigns upwards to 100 pages of reading a week. 20 page paper worth only 20% of final grade. 2 group projects. And a multiple choice exam (?). It is impossible to do well. Uninteresting and irrelevant information. More of a philosophy class than a research class. This is literally the worst class I have taken in my undergrad.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Best Qualitative class of all time! All other teachers are trash. Take him if ya can xD

This prof was TERRIBLE. Just such a bad prof... I feel really sorry for any future students that will have this guy. If you can, avoid him at all costs. If you are unable to then just know that you will get through this and the victimization will end. Best of luck.
this was the most difficult class I had to take. Almost impossible to score above a C. Just avoid this prof he really is not worth the pain and suffering for the terrible mark you'll most likely get.
BRUTAL prof. Avoid at all costs
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'So many papers', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: I took his contemporary critical theory class, he was very informative and his lectures flowed consistently. Hottest prof in the school, let me do extra catch up assignments and allowed deadlines to be missed without repercussions. Overall great prof

Frauley really loves his Criminological Imagination Class and he really presses you to think beyond what other teachers have focused on in Crim. However, his readings are outrageous size wise. The breakdown of the class is extremely punishing, as 45% of the grade is a randomly selected reading response. Also, no grade given before drop date.

He was a nice enough guy but his courses were very dull. He assigned too many readings, they were impossible to keep up with. Even more so, you had to do the readings each week in order to hand in a summary each week. These summaries are worth 20% of your final grade.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: This prof has interesting lectures. However, he marks so unfairly its ridiculous. It is not clear whatsoever as to what he is expecting of students and takes no time to clarify. Even after I emailed and went to his office, I received a poor grade on all my assignments and he told me that I did not understand the project. I will not be back, sorry!
Passionate prof who will take the time to help you if you've taken the time to help yourself.

expects you talk in class and do the readings every week. he won't summarise the readings so you have to do them to follow the discussion. if your unprepared for yoer presentation he let's you know and expects everyone to do more than regurgitate the readings.

He comes up with different ways of making sure you do the readings (write summaries, do presentations, participation marks, etc) because he knows his students are FORCED to be there and have no interest in methodology. Course is easy enough but he is an arrogant snob. He will tear apart students during their presenations. Avoid him if possible!!

Took his research methodology class. Really easy class, but his lectures are soooo boring, and regurgitates the text. You could just read the text and stay home except for the weekly assignments that summarize the text! So self-indulged that he'd rather talk about his research on second life than help his students out

I took his research methodology class; a mandatory course for crim students. He knows we're only there because we have to be and seems to dislike his students. Easy content but his lectures still manage to be unclear and boring. He seems to think very highly of himself. Textbook AND coursepack readings with weekly assignments / paper at the end!
